div.p: This Internet-based service is used to provide weather-related school closure information and important information in the event of an emergency. Parents can sign-up for email alerts and download the Flash Alert app to receive push notifications. To sign up for Flash Alert notifications, visit the FlashAlert website.
In the event of an emergency or inclement weather, schools may need to close, delay the start of school or release students early.
div.h4: Inclement Weather Information Messages for Parents/Guardians/Community
div.p: In the event of inclement weather, school closures or delayed start decisions will typically be made and posted on the District website by 5:15 a.m. Details will be communicated to local media (including TV, radio, and newspapers) via FlashAlert. Information is also sent to parents via SchoolMessenger and Remind, and posted to the District’s Facebook and Twitter accounts.
We encourage and support families to make attendance decisions for your child(ren) based on your own assessment of travel conditions at your location.

p.strong: When all district schools and facilities are closed:

ul.li: All daytime and evening activities/events are canceled.

p.strong: When there is a 2-hour delay in opening school:

ul.li:
All schools will be open two hours later than regularly scheduled.
Exception: On Monday, regular late-start is canceled. A 2-hour delay is calculated from regular start times (Tuesday-Friday). These are the start times for 2-hour delay on Monday-Friday during delayed start for inclement weather (current as of 12/3/2019):

p.strong: When school is on time and buses are on snow routes:

ul.li: All schools operate on regular daily schedules.
If weather conditions substantially improve by 11:00 a.m., any changes in afternoon bus service will be communicated no later than 1:00 p.m.

p.strong: When weather conditions necessitate an early closure of schools:

ul.li: We encourage you to refer to our website and local media for more detailed information.
All daytime and evening activities/events are canceled.

div.p: En el caso de que haya mal tiempo, se tomarán decisiones sobre el cierre de las escuelas o de comienzo de clases más tarde. Estas decisiones se publicarán en el sitio web del Distrito antes de las 5:15 a.m. Los detalles serán comunicados a través de FlashAlert a los medios de información locales (incluyendo televisión, radio y periódicos). También se enviará la información a los padres a través de SchoolMessenger y será publicada en las páginas de Facebook y Twitter del Distrito.
Alentamos y apoyamos a las familias a tomar sus propias decisiones sobre la asistencia de su/s hijo/s basándose en su propia evaluación de las condiciones de viaje desde su ubicación.
